Ingredients:
 3 cups of water
 2 and 1/3 cups of chicken broth
 Quarter cup of butter
 Half an onion, chopped
 rice cup
 Half a cup of cooking cream
 Â¼ cup grated parmesan cheese
 salt and pepper as needed
 Chopped parsley for garnish
 How to prepare
 Heat the water with the broth on a medium heat until it boils, reduce the heat and leave it on the fire.
 Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a saucepan over a medium heat, add the onion and stir until it wilts.
 Add the rice and stir for two minutes, then add a third of a cup of the broth and water mixture, and stir until it is absorbed.
 Raise the heat of the fire and add another cup of broth, then leave the pot on the fire
 without covering it until all the liquids are absorbed. Repeat this step, adding a cup of broth at a time and waiting until
 it is absorbed until the broth is used up. Leave it on the fire for 25 minutes until it becomes creamy in texture.
 Add cream, cheese, salt, pepper and the rest of the butter, stir for two minutes.
 Garnish with parsley and serve.
